poem:
Title: "In The Throes of The Gasoline Age"

In this moment, tire-marked 2023,
Half of all whispers are now roars,
Heavy to breathe in, weighty to see.
Metal beasts bred in chrome foundries,
Their exhales clouding our clarity,
Carbon lullabies serenading the skies,
An unflattering silhouette against blue.
In the rearview mirror, Earth sighs.
Seeking her respite, where do we steer,
In this dance on the edge of atmosphere?
